"Recipe Wizard is a simple recipe app that allows you to import, export and" "share recipes as plain, human-readable text.

You can share one recipe (via text, email, etc) or your entire collection of recipes" "(mostly via email).

In addition, you can capture text and convert it into a recipe with (for the most part)" "very little editing. Capturing text can be done by pasting text into the app, by" "loading images containing text (e.g. screenshots), or by taking pictures of printed" "recipes. Pulling recipes from image or the camera tends to require a bit more editing" "but (again, for the most part) works pretty well.

NOTE: On some devices, you might get a "can't access camera" message." "If you get this, go into your phone's settings, find the app permissions for Recipe Wizard, and explicitly turn on the camera permissions.
"
"The servings and measurement system controls let you alter the recipe to suit your needs. Recipe Wizard will (for the most part) convert the ingredients and instruction to match your selections."
"On this screen, you can type in a recipe, filling in the name, ingredients and directions, and specifying the number of servings and whether it's imperial or metric."
"The Save button saves the recipe to your collection. It'll be added to the list, sorted by name."
"The Capture button lets you create a recipe from plain text, an image, or your camera."
"The Capture screen lets you grab a recipe from plain text, an image of a recipe, or from the device's camera."

"The Camera button starts up the camera and lets you take pictures of a printed recipe. Just tap the screen to grab the text. If you have a recipe that spans several pages, or needs to be captured in pieces, just keep taking pictures. Recipe Wizard will string all the text together."
"The Image button works pretty much the same, but with images saved on your device."

"The text you've captured will probably need a bit of cleanup. Once you've got it in a reasonable format, tap the Done button to take you back to the Add screen, where you can save it to your recipe collection."
"The Delete button should be fairly self-explanatory."

"The menu bar contains icons (depending on context) for...
Home: Go back to the main screen.
Shopping Cart: View your grocery list.
Help: View this screen."
"This screen lists all the available recipes in your collection. Tapping on the name of a recipe lets you view the details.\n"

"The search bar lets you find recipes in your collection. Typing a single word or phrase will bring up all" "the recipes that contain that word or phrase, sorted by title. Typing a list of words or phrases will list all the" "recipes that contain at least one of them in the ingredients, sorted by best match.\n"

"The Add to Cart button adds the ingredients of the recipe you're viewing to your grocery list." "Recipe Wizard will attempt to consolidate similar ingredients into a single grocery list item" "(e.g. 1/2 lb chicken + 1 lb chicken = 1 1/2 lb chicken."

"The grocery list displays the ingredients you've added from the View Recipe screen. You can add items" "by filling in the blank item at the top of the list, or hitting Enter at the end of any existing one" "to insert it into the middle of the list.

The list is saved whenever you leave the screen," "including the items you've checked off.

You can share the grocery list, or just copy it and paste it into another app.
"
"The Recalculate button will search for items with the same description and attempt to consolidate" "them into a single item."
"The drag handle to the left of each item allows you to reorder items so you can, say, group all the produce" "items together."
"Tapping the X on the right will delete an item if you've already got it in the pantry."
"The Add button allows you to add a new recipe. You can type it in manually, or capture it from text, an image, or the camera."

The \"Magic\" button allows you to make certain sections of a recipe\'s directions non-scalable. For example, if the directions include \"add 1 tsp to each muffin tin\", you wouldn\'t want that to change to \"2 tsp\" when you double the servings. This button will only show up if Recipe Wizard detects scalable ingredients in the directions.
"The Share button lets you share your entire recipe collection. Typically, you'd send that as an email attachment."
This screen lets you edit a recipe. It works pretty much like the Add Recipe screen, with the exception that the Capture button has been replaced by a Delete button.

"The Import button lets you either add to or replace your recipe collection with a file stored on your device. Ideally, the file is an export from someone else's app, but you can pull from any text file with an appropriate format."
"The Export button lets you save your entire collection to a file on your device. You can use this as a backup, or send the file to another user to import into their collection."
"On this screen, you can view a recipe's details."
"The Edit button allows you to edit the current recipe. This will alter the original recipe, even if you've changed the servings or measurement system on this screen."
"The Share button lets you share the current recipe, in plain text. If you've changed the servings or measurement system, you'll have the option of sending the original, or altered version."
